author: mklement0
body:
* `-Raw` reads the entire file as a whole, as a single string.
* `-ReadCount` is for batching groups of lines into arrays.

The two behaviors are mutually exclusive.
Currently, `-ReadCount` is simply _ignored_:

```
1..5 > t.txt; (Get-Content -Raw -ReadCount 2 t.txt | Measure-Object).Count
1   # -ReadCount was ignored.
```

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
'hi' > t.txt
{ Get-Content -Raw -ReadCount 2 t.txt } | Should -Throw
```

# Expected behavior

The test should pass.

# Actual behavior

The test fails, because the combination of parameters is unexpectedly allowed.

# Environment data

```none
PowerShell Core 7.0.0-preview.6
```
title: Get-Content -Raw should be mutually exclusive with -ReadCount
